meanings.definition: A line that marks the date on which something was written or issued.
meanings.sent1: The dateline on the letter showed it was written last week.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper article had a dateline from New York.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't believe the dateline on the ancient scroll was still visible.
meanings.sent4: The fading dateline on the document hinted at its age.
meanings.sent5: The clear dateline on the package ensured timely delivery.

meanings.definition: A line at the beginning of a news article that states the date and place of origin.
meanings.sent1: The dateline at the top of the article indicated it was from London.
meanings.sent2: Every news story should have a proper dateline for clarity.
meanings.sent3: The dateline on the gossip column made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The dateline of the breaking news was like a beacon for readers.
meanings.sent5: The missing dateline left readers puzzled about the article's source.
